body.p: Members of its resource group and others told the FASB that in practice acquirers often did not recognise an acquiree’s assets and liabilities arising from contingencies at the acquisition date. Instead, contingencies were recognised after the acquisition date at an amount determined at that later date either because their amount could not be ‘reasonably estimated’ or because the contingency was determined not to meet the SFAS 5 ‘probability’ criterion for recognition.
